newsitem.title: USA: NASD to accuse brokers over tests - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: NASD to accuse brokers over tests - WSJ.

text.p: The National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD) will accuse more than two dozen fledgling brokers of having impostors take their licensing examinations for them, The Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.
The NASD also will impose lifetime bans on the dealers to keep them from working on Wall Street.
The association's enforcement arm, in a four-month investigation, examined allegations that brokers improperly claimed to have taken the so-called Series 7 or other licensing examinations.
Instead, regulators, believe, the brokers had others take the qualification exams for them. Other brokers who had failed the test in New York claimed to have taken the test out of state and passed.
Most of the brokers who will be named in the action work for small securities firms, people familiar with the case said. No firms will be named in the case.
The newspaper did not say when the action might be filed.
